intro: Zahlbrucknera maranhonis, commonly known as the Maranhão zygostemon, is a rare flowering plant native to the Atlantic Forest of Brazil. It belongs to the family Lamiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant features opposite, ovate leaves with a velvety texture and produces small, tubular flowers in shades of purple and white. It is characterized by its unique floral structure and is often found in shaded, moist environments. Due to habitat loss, it is considered endangered and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
